III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1 – CCI Rule 400.4158 (1)(a)(ii)
Staff scratched Youth A’s ear.
Allegation 2 – CCI Rule 400.4158 (1)(a)(iv)
Staff made derogatory remarks about Youth A being gender fluid.
Investigation Allegation 1
Interviews
Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 11/16/2023 by phone. Complainant
did not have additional information.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 11/09/2023 at Mott Childrens Residence.
Youth A stated he had a hard time going to bed a while ago (date
unknown) and wanted to put on his slides to go outside. Youth A
stated Staff Person 4 tried to take away his slides and somehow
scratched his left ear in the process. Youth A stated it was an
accident and did not have further details. Youth A was observed
with a pin size dot in the middle of his left ear lobe and a ¼ inch
linear, superficial mark in the middle of his left ear lobe that looked
like dry skin. Youth A stated there were no witnesses to this
incident because the other youths were asleep.
Staff Person 4
I interviewed Staff Person 4 on 11/16/2023 by phone. Staff Person
4 stated she did not recall the date Youth A walked in and out of
the unit during bedtime and threatened to go outside. Staff Person
4 stated in the process of taking Youth A’s shoes, she somehow
touched his ear. Staff Person 4 stated Youth A said, “You
scratched my ear.” Staff Person 4 stated she did not see a scratch
2

mark or blood on Youth A’s ear. Staff Person 4 stated she asked
Youth A if he needed to see the nurse and he said, “No.” Staff
Person 4 stated she apologized to Youth A and told him that it
was an accident to which Youth A said, “I know.” Staff Person 4
stated the incident happened in late 10/2023 in Johnson unit’s
common area. Staff Person 4 was unsure if she wrote an incident
report.
Medical Aid
I interviewed Medical Aid on 11/16/2023 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Medical Aid stated she was asked by a Mott Childrens
Residence administrator (name unknown) on 11/09/2023 to
evaluate Youth A’s ear due to the initiation of this investigation.
Medical Aid stated Youth A had a superficial mark like dry skin
and a dot on his ear lobe. Medical Aid stated Youth A told her the
mark on his ear lobe was an accident caused by staff when he put
on his shoes and stood up.
Documentation
There is no incident report written by Staff Person 4 regarding the
scratch to Youth A’s ear lobe.
Medical Aid wrote a nursing note dated 11/09/2023. Medical Aid
wrote Youth A stated a staff person accidentally scratched his left
ear lobe. Youth A stated he did not try to pierce his ear. It states
Youth A was unable to provide further details.
Staff Person 4’s employee file was reviewed on 11/16/2023. Staff
Person 4 was hired in 10/2022 and does not have discipline
history.
Video
Video review was not requested because the date and time are
unknown for this incident. Whaley Children’s Center completes
random video reviews and nothing matching this incident was
seen during the random video reviews.
Tour
Johnson Center is one of three units at Mott Children’s Residence.
There are two couches, chairs, staff table, television, and storage
cubbies in the common area. There is a door in the common area
that leads to the outside.
Allegation 2
Interviews
3

Complainant
I spoke with Complainant by phone on 11/16/2023. Complainant
did not have additional information.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 11/09/2023 at Mott Childrens Residence.
Youth A did not have concerns with staff or youth making
comments about being gender fluid. Youth A stated he has issues
with Staff Person 1 because she acts like only her feelings matter.
Youth A stated there was an incident by the medication room with
Staff Person 1 and Youth B. Youth A stated he does not have
additional information because he returned to the unit.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 11/09/2023 at Mott Childrens Residence.
Youth B stated she is unaware of staff and youth making
inappropriate, derogatory remarks about Youth A. Youth B was
asked about recent incidents involving Staff Person 1. Youth B
stated Staff Person 1 has a poor attitude and said she hated
working with us (Mott Childrens Residence youths). Youth B
stated Staff Person 1 yelled at Youth C and asked Youth C what
was wrong with her. Youth B stated she told Staff Person 1 that
Youth C acts younger than her age and asked Staff Person 1 to
stop yelling at Youth C. Youth B stated Staff Person 1 said, “No, it
is one my triggers.” Youth B could not provide additional context to
Staff person 1’s statement. Youth B stated Staff person 1 began
yelling at Youth B until Staff Person 2 and Staff person 3
intervened. Youth B stated Staff Person 1 left the area and the
incident ended. Youth B stated this incident occurred by the
nursing station during medication dispensing. Youth B did not
know the date of the incident. Youth B stated Youth A was a
witness to this incident.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C on 11/16/2023 at Mott Childrens Residence.
Youth C was asked if she knew Staff Person 1. Youth C
responded that Staff Person 1 was a “bitch.” Youth C was asked if
there was a recent incident between her and Staff Person 1.
Youth C stated Staff Person 1 yelled at her in the medication line,
but could not recall what was said. Youth C stated Youth B, who
was also in the medication line, is like a big sister and protects
her. Youth C stated Youth B threatened to punch Staff Person 1 if
Staff Person 1 came closer to Youth C. Youth C stated she went
back to the unit and does not know what happened next.
Staff Person 1
4

I left messages on 11/16/2023, 11/20/2023 and11/27/2023 for
Staff Person 1 and did not receive a return call. Administrator 1
confirmed by email on 11/27/2023 that Staff Person 1 has not
been at the facility or returned phone calls from the facility since
11/09/2023. Administrator 1 stated Staff Person 1’s employment
was terminated via mail on 11/20/2023.
Staff Person 2
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 11/16/2023 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff Person 2 stated she heard Youth B yelling about
Staff Person 1 in the hallway by the medication room. Staff Person
2 stated she did not recall what was said. Staff Person 2 stated
she responded by providing verbal redirection to Youth B and the
incident ended when Staff Person 1 walked away. Staff Person 2
did not recall the date of this incident.
Staff Person 3
I interviewed Staff Person 3 on 11/16/2023 by phone. Staff Person
3 stated she heard yelling from the main hallway and responded
to the situation. Staff Person 3 stated Youth B was by the
medication window yelling at Staff Person 1 for not listening. Staff
Person 3 stated she provided verbal redirection to Youth B and
requested Staff Person 1 to leave the area because Staff person 1
appeared to be Youth B’s focus. Staff Person 3 stated Staff
Person 1 left and the incident ended. Staff Person 3 did not recall
the date of this incident.
Documentation
Staff Person 1’s employee file was reviewed on 11/16/2023. Staff
Person 1 was hired in 07/2023 and does not have discipline
history.
There is no incident report about Staff Person 1 and Youth B or
Staff Person 1 and Youth C.
Video
Video review was not requested because the date and time are
unknown for this incident. Whaley Children’s Center completes
random video reviews and nothing matching this incident was
seen during the random video reviews.
Tour
The nursing office is also the medication dispensing room at Mott
Children’s Residence. The nursing office is in the main hallway,
which connects the three units of Mott Children’s Residence.
5

Analysis Allegation 1
Staff Person 4 accidentally scratched Youth A’s left ear lobe when
he stood up after putting on his slides.
Allegation 2
It is not found that staff made derogatory remarks about Youth A
being gender fluid. Staff Person 1 and Youth B had a heated
verbal exchange about Youth C. Staff Person 1 has not worked at
Mott Children Residence and has not returned the facility’s phone
calls since the initiation of this investigation on 11/09/2023. Staff
Person 1 was terminated on 11/20/2023.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
